馳駆: (ちく) - dashing around on a horse; running around; exerting oneself (for another)
馴らし: (ナラシ) - running-in; breaking in (e.g. engine, etc.); accustomizing; warming up
馴らす: (ならす) - (esp. 慣らす) to accustom/to train (e.g. one's ear); (esp. 馴らす) to tame/to domesticate/to train (e.g. an animal)
馴れっこ: (なれっこ) - being used to ...; getting used to ...; being accustomed to; being conditioned to; be familiar with
馴れっこになる: (なれっこになる) - to become used to; to become familiar with; to grow accustomed to
馴れる: (なれる) - (esp. 慣れる) to get used to/to grow accustomed to/to become familiar with; (esp. 慣れる) to become skilled in/to become experienced at; (esp. 馴れる) to become tame/to become domesticated
馴れ初め: (なれそめ) - start of a romance; beginning of love
馴れ合い: (なれあい) - collusion/conspiracy; common-law marriage/illicit intercourse/liaison
馴れ合い夫婦: (なれあいふうふ) - common-law couple; couple in an illicit union
馴れ合う: (なれあう) - to collude (with); to conspire (with); to establish a secret liaison (with); to make friends with; to get along well with; to become intimate (with opposite sex)
馴れ寿司: (なれずし) - narezushi; fermented sushi (pickled in brine rather than vinegar), precursor of modern sushi
馴染ませる: (なじませる) - to blend/to mix thoroughly and evenly; to make fit in/to domesticate
馴染み深い: (なじみぶかい) - extremely intimate; very well-acquainted
馴染む: (なじむ) - to become familiar with; to fit in; to adapt oneself; to get used to; to grow accustomed to
馴致: (じゅんち) - taming; gradual habituation; leading to
馴鮨: (なれずし) - narezushi; fermented sushi (pickled in brine rather than vinegar), precursor of modern sushi
駁する: (ばくする) - to oppose someone's opinion; to refute; to contradict
駁撃: (ばくげき) - attacking (someone's argument); arguing against; refuting; taking issue; contradicting
駄: (da) - oneroso, pobre, de baixa qualidade, trivial, insignificante, sem valor; carga, fardo, carga de cavalo; cavalo de carga
駄々っ児: (だだっこ) - unmanageable child; spoiled child (spoilt); spoiled brat
駄々っ子: (だだっこ) - unmanageable child; spoiled child (spoilt); spoiled brat
駄々をこねる: (だだをこねる) - to be unreasonable; to whine; to throw a tantrum
駄々を捏ねる: (だだをこねる) - to be unreasonable; to whine; to throw a tantrum
駄じゃれ: (ダジャレ) - feeble joke; bad pun
駄弁る: (ダベる) - to jabber; to chatter; to chat with
駄文: (だぶん) - poor piece of writing; my poor writing
駄洒落: (ダジャレ) - feeble joke; bad pun
駄目: (dame) - sem valor, não cumprindo sua função, inútil, quebrado; sem esperança, desperdiçado, em vão, sem propósito; não pode, não deve, não permitido; ponto neutro (no jogo de go), interseção não controlada por nenhum jogador ao final de uma partida
駄目で元々: (だめでもともと) - giving something a try because one has nothing to lose
駄目になる: (だめになる) - to spoil; to break; to go bad; to go wrong; to fail
駄目を押す: (だめをおす) - to make sure; to make doubly sure
駄目人間: (だめにんげん) - useless member of society; hopeless case; failure
駄目元: (だめもと) - giving something a try because one has nothing to lose
駄目出し: (だめだし) - judging someone (negatively) and urging them to improve; finding fault (in somebody's work)
駄目押し: (だめおし) - making doubly sure; {baseb} insurance runs
駄目駄目: (ダメダメ) - entirely useless/completely worthless; no no/don't!
駄袋: (だんぶくろ) - large cloth sack; baggy trousers (worn in the late-Edo and early-Meiji periods by samurai while practising)
駄賃: (だちん) - reward; tip; carriage or horse charge
駄酒落: (ダジャレ) - feeble joke; bad pun
駄駄っ児: (だだっこ) - unmanageable child; spoiled child (spoilt); spoiled brat
駄駄っ子: (だだっこ) - unmanageable child; spoiled child (spoilt); spoiled brat
駄駄をこねる: (だだをこねる) - to be unreasonable; to whine; to throw a tantrum
駄駄を捏ねる: (だだをこねる) - to be unreasonable; to whine; to throw a tantrum
駅: (eki) - station , railway station, train station; staging post on a highway (no Japão pré-moderno)
駅に止まる: (えきにとまる) - to stop at a (train) station
駅チカ: (えきチカ) - underground shopping arcade near a station
駅ナカ: (エキナカ) - shopping area within a train station
駅メロ: (えきメロ) - station melody; departure melody; melody sounded on a station platform just before the doors of a train are closed
駅中: (エキナカ) - shopping area within a train station
駅伝: (えきでん) - long-distance relay race; stagecoach/post horse
駅伝競走: (えきでんきょうそう) - long-distance relay race
駅使: (はゆまづかい) - official during the ritsuryo period who was allowed to use the state-provided stables and horses
駅前留学: (えきまえりゅうがく) - attending foreign language study at a school near the train station (esp. used as a NOVA catchphrase)
駅前通り: (えきまえどおり) - street in front of station
駅員: (ekiin) - (funcionário da estação de trem, empregado da estação, pessoal da estação)
駅子: (えきし) - staff at a horse changing station during the ritsuryo period
駅弁: (えきべん) - boxed lunch bought at a station (often a local specialty); variety of sexual position
駅弁大学: (えきべんだいがく) - minor local college; small-time university
駅張りポスター: (えきばりポスター) - advertising poster in a station
駅止め: (えきどめ) - delivery of freight to a station
駅留め: (えきどめ) - delivery of freight to a station
